fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39056]. {panel} h3. Summary URLs with apostrophes/quotes do not create valid links when added via Insert Link h3. Environment Internet Explorer, Chrome and Firefox h3. Steps to Reproduce # Click Insert Link # Select Web link # Add address {{https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Confluence+will+not+start+up+because+the+build+number+in+the+home+directory+doesn't+match+the+build+number+in+the+database%2C+after+upgrade}} # Add link any text # Click Insert # Save the page h3. Expected Results Text becomes a hyperlink h3. Actual Results The link doesn't work and the storage format HTML appears as {code:language=html/xml}

this is a link

{code} h3.Workaround # Copy a correct URL encoded version of the URL from the page, or via a link to the page # Edit the page and replace the original URL with the encoded URL # Save the page
fields.summary: Can not create long or urlencoded web link

fields.description:
I know it's an odd thing to do, but if you set the search page size past SearchConstants.MAX_LIMIT then the search will return SearchConstants.MAX_LIMIT results but when you step to the next page it will use the requested page size as it's start point skipping the results in the middle.

The search should probably throw an exception when more results than SearchConstants.MAX_LIMIT are requested, or cap the page size to the limit.
fields.summary: Setting search size past SearchConstants.MAX_LIMIT produces invalid behaviour

fields.description:
h1. Symptoms

The next incremental sync just after an authentication fails and produces an stacktrace in the logs:

{noformat}
2013-04-12 10:21:48,053 scheduler_Worker-1 ERROR [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] Incremental synchronisation was unexpectedly interrupted, falling back to a full synchronisation
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.MembershipAlreadyExistsException: Membership already exists in directory [32770] from child entity [user] to parent entity [group]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.dao.membership.MembershipDAOHibernate.addUserToGroup(MembershipDAOHibernate.java:102)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.AbstractInternalDirectory.addUserToGroup(AbstractInternalDirectory.java:712)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations.addUserToGroup(DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations.java:1151)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:601)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:319)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:183)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:150)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:110)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:172)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:202)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.$Proxy159.addUserToGroup(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations.addUserToGroup(DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations.java:189)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.EventTokenChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseChanges(EventTokenChangedCacheRefresher.java:119)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.synchroniseCache(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:629)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserImpl.synchronise(DirectorySynchroniserImpl.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller.pollChanges(DbCachingDirectoryPoller.java:50)
{noformat}

h1. Steps to reproduce

# Set up a Remote Crowd directory/Jira Directory, configure it to automatically add users to a group on login.
# Sync the directory.
# In the remote Crowd server, create a user. Do not add him to the group.
# Authenticate as the new user in the client application. This causes the user and his memberships to be copied from the server. It also causes the user to be added to the default group in both the client application and the remote server.
# Sync the directory.

h1. Expected result

Client and server are already in sync, the incremental sync should succeed without making any update.

h1. Actual outcome

Incremental sync attempts to create the membership to the default group again. Since this membership already exists in the client, an exception is thrown and incremental sync fails.
fields.summary: Incremental sync fails after authentication if default groups have been added to a Jira directory
The color picker in confluence must be the same as JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39052].
  {panel}

Have just started to play with the Roadmap Planner macro and have found an issue that I'm not sure whether it is a bug with this functionality or unrelated (also not sure whether it is a known issue), but have found that the accuracy of the placement of markers is almost an inch off between edit and save modes while in weeks mode.  

ie:
- Added a marker for 5th October
- Shows up as 28th Sep in preview/saved mode
- Edit the macro and change the marker to ~25th October and save
- Shows up as 5th Oct

Note: The same applies to bars created and moved manually, ie: bars initially created appear fine, but once moved off the starting line they appear to fall in to the same issue.
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner Macro - Marker (and Bar) accuracy incorrect

*Background*
Users want to track the status of his task, per page.
There are some macros on Confluence. However, these macros are inconvenient for tracking the status of task

|Task Macro|It is just for one status change.|
|Starus Macro|It cannot be edited from viewpage.|
|Label|Users need to type the exact label name.| 

*Request* 
Add the Radio Button function to Confluence.

*Expected Result*
Users can make single choice from selection list, from viewpage.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39043].
  {panel}

There are multiple places in Confluence code (although not so many!) where direct access to {{window.parent}} and {{window.top}} is made. This breaks violently when Confluence is run inside IFRAME and the parent frames are in another domain.

We need to show Confluence page inside a JIRA plugin to bring Confluence pages and JIRA issues together on one screen. 

I hope it won't be too much problem to fix this in the future. 

Thanks
Igor
fields.summary: Make Confluence be able to run inside IFRAME

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39037].

h3. Summary
Content by Label Macro can only be updated once, if you update the Macro twice the _Save_ button is grayed out. 

Affected Version: 5.9.1-OD-2015.36.1-0001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create _How-to-article page_ 
# Edit the _Content Label Macro_, add _Of type_:Pagel; Click _Save_
# Edit the Macro again: _Of type is empty and the Save button is grayed out

h3. Expected Results
Ability to edit the _Content by Label Macro_ more than once without saving the entire page

h3. Actual Results
Unable to edit the _Content Label Macro_ more than once

h3. Notes
If you edit the _Content by label_ macro twice, you won't be able to add any other macro

h3.Workaround
Cancel updates on the macro, save the page and edit the macro again.
fields.summary: Content by label macro cannot be updated more than once
Comments should allow save/submission via Ctrl+Enter

fields.description: h3. Summary The CSS class 'unresolved' is no more present for unresolved links in the Confluence . In version for example Confluence 5.4 or 5.6 the class is available h3. Steps to Reproduce # Login to Confluence as Admin # Add a user eg: test # Create a Page and add restrictions to the page for viewing only to Admin user. # Copy the link of this page on Clipboard # Login as test user # Create a new Page and paste the link which was copied earlier. # Save the Page # Right click on the link and Click on Inspect element . h3. Expected Results The link is set as unresolved and contain a CSS class in the source as below {{test Home}} h3. Actual Results The link has no class as 'unresolved' {{http://localhost:8090/display/TEST/test+Home}} h3. Notes Users need this class for customization purpose and the class is now not available . EG: make the link colour as RED
fields.summary: CSS class 'unresolved' not available for unresolved links

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39028].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
As Confluence page names must be unique within a space, the _Import Word Document_ in Confluence would fail should there are duplicate headings exist in that Word document file, given the _Split by heading_ option is chosen.


h5. Suggested Solution
To implement a feature that will automatically handle this error by adding padding to those duplicates headings.


h6. Workaround
Remove any duplicate headings before importing the affected Word document
fields.summary: Add Padding on Duplicate Headings for Import Word Document Feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39027].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
As of now, should an error occurred while trying to import a Word document by using the _Import Word Document_ feature in Confluence, the generic _Oops - an error has occurred_ will then be shown in the Confluence UI.


h5. Suggested Solution
As there are a couple of known bugs on this (Please refer to _Issue Links_ section). It would be better if an error handling is implemented to give more details to the user on what's causing the error.
fields.summary: Implement Error Handling on Failed to Import Word Document

fields.description:
There is an issue where the roadmap macro shows incorrect dates in normal page-view mode, but the storage format, and edit mode render correctly.

*Edit Mode*
Shows correctly (as placed by the user):
!Edit Mode.png|width=600!

*View Mode*
Incorrect display:
!View Mode.png|width=600!

The [^Edit Placeholder.png] graphic also renders incorrectly

Behind the scenes, the storage data is correct:
* Raw: [^Storage Format - raw.txt]
* JSON Prettified extract: [^Storage Format - Prettified Extract.txt]

Taking the first swimlane as an example, and tidying up the storage format -- you get the following:
{code}
         "bars":[ 
            { 
               "title":"BAR-A",
              "startDate":"2015-09-27 23:20:11",
...
            },
            { 
               "title":"BAR-C",
               "startDate":"2015-09-28 04:19:36",
...
            },
            { 
               "startDate":"2015-09-28 02:39:48",
               "title":"BAR-B",
...
            }
{code}

All *startdate* values show 2015-09-27 or 2015-09-28 ... but the "view" render clearly two of the items clearly in the week before.

We're a few dot-releases behind, but I've checked all the release notes and don't see any fix that would address this.
This may be the same issue as reported here - CONF-38800, but I wasn't certain sorry.
I've tried to include additional debug information to isolate the problem.

--

This makes the roadmap macro quite unusable -- as it's for 99% of users (e.g. not the author) it is communicating incorrect dates.
fields.summary: [Roadmap Macro] Bars not showing correct dates, differing view between edit/view modes

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39019].
  {panel}

*As a* user of Confluence,
*in order to* find my stuff easier be it content or labels,
*I want to* be able to search case insensitive.

*Acceptance criteria*
* labels and content (consequently the pages they are on) can be found independently on how they are written (in terms of case, e.g. CamelCase or camelcase, ...)
* this is the default way it works

*Note*
* see also https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/13414134/answers/25145167?flashId=2031749391
fields.summary: Allow case insensitivity for Confluence - or make the search and indexing better

fields.description:
This cause a user to automatically watch a page when they add an attachment to the page. This bug cause unnecessary notication that causes major spam in the user mailbox.

h3.Step to replicate
# {{Go to User Profile >> Settings  >> Email}}  and disable the *autowatch*
# Add an attachment to an existing page

h3. Observed behaviour
User who added the attachment are now watching the page.

*Extra Note* 
This issue does not occur in Confluence 5.6.6 and below.
fields.summary: Page is automatically watched by user if they add an attachment to the page even with the "autowatch" setting disabled.

fields.description:
When editing a page, particularly when copying and pasting, content frequently gets copied to random places, often to the top of the page.

When I return to edit pages, I often notice that my tables have taken on columns from other tables and the cell content is a mixture of what was already in the table and what has been copied from another table.

It seems fairly random but is extremely frequent.  Just by doing a lot of editing, you can reproduce.
fields.summary: When editing a page, content is often copied to the top, tables are copied and mangled

fields.description:
Steps to recreate
1. Create a new template
2. Create a table with 4 variables
3. Set the following 4 properties: First variable is text, Second as List (enter item as Yes,No,Invalid), Third as List (enter item as Active,Inactive), Fourth variable is text
4. Save the template

Result
In view template mode, it only the Third value’s dropdownlist was displayed, Second value dropdown is an empty box.

When re-entered to the Edit Mode, discovered that the dropdown list is auto-deleted.

Expected Result
All values with dropdown list will displayed properly.
Note: Values with text variable does work properly.
fields.summary: Creating a template in Confluence with list variables will cause only 1 value to actually displayed dropdown list properly.

fields.description:
Background: we have a Confluence with 8 JIRA instances.

We just identified the following bug:
# User opens a Confluence page and opens the editor
# User copies a link of a JIRA issue on an instance that is not defined as standard instance
# User pastes this JIRA link into the editor
# Editor will create a JIRA macro out of the link
# User saves the page

*Actual result:* User does not see the issue. Instead he gets the error 'JIRA Issues Macro: Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error'

*Desired result:* User sees the content of the macro displayed correctly.

*Problem:* When pasting links from JIRA instances that are not standard, Confluence will not consider these different server ids. It will always use the server id for the macro which is defined as standard.

Again, a very ugly bug that makes life hard for our users.
fields.summary: Pasting JIRA issue link on confluence page does not work if multiple JIRA instances are connected

fields.description:
h5.Steps to reproduce
# Create a task in a version of Confluence before 5.5; and leave the task unticked (i.e not done)
# After more than 6 months, upgrade Confluence to a version higher than 5.5

h5.Expected Results
The task appears in the "Tasks" page of the user profile

h5.Actual Results
The task does not appear in the "Tasks" page of the user profile

h5.Notes
When designing the "Tasks" page we made a conscious decision to display only tasks that were newer than 6 months from the date of the upgrade. This was to avoid overwhelming users that had a large number of incomplete tasks older than 6 months.

At the bottom of the page, we have a link that states "For a custom view, create a task report".

h5.Suggested Fix
We should include information about the cutoff in the tasks screen, with something along the lines of the following:

{quote}
Not seeing all your tasks? This page only shows tasks for the last 6 months - for more flexibility, create a Task Report page.
{quote}

with a link to creating a task report page; just as we have now. This would reduce confusion and make it clear that the system is operating correctly.
fields.summary: The tasks summary page only displays the last 6 months worth of information

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The horizontal scroll bar disappears when editing and clicking Page Layout 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a page with table of 10 columns and 100 rows or wide enough to make the horizontal scroll bar appear
2. When Viewing saved page you can see see the horizontal scroll bar
3. Click Edit and you can still see the scroll bar
4. In Edit mode click Page Layout and the scroll bar disappears

h3. Expected Results
The scroll bar would remain for easy editing in Page Layout view
h3. Actual Results
The horizontal scroll bar disappears
h3.Workaround
In MacOS, use gesture to scroll, for Windows, press the scroll wheel on the mouse to bring up the horizontal scroll option.
fields.summary: Scroll bar disappears in Page Layout view

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39008].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have a feature that the comment's authors could choose who is able to see their comments.

At the moment, you can only restrict users and groups to edit it(_add/delete_) on Spaces Permissions, but not viewing.

*Customer's Example:*

If I am putting comment to my administrator to send my credentials , there should be a way that only my administrator or member of administrators group should be able to see and reply.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38989].
  {panel}

*Background of the request*
When editing in 5.4 , the text "Draft autosaved at hh:mm (view change)" used to be shown at the bottom of the window, and when you clicked on "view change" it did what it says.

In 5.8 Edit mode, this has moved to the formatting bar and no longer says "view change" - but if you click on the text you get the view change dialog as before.

The "view change" text should be reinserted and the feature available in Preview mode (as it was in 5.4).
fields.summary: "View change" option removed in 5.8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38988].
  {panel}

It seems that the icons in Confluence are currently rendered using fontset. This can be an issue for organization especially banks that have strict security constraint (fontset cannot be downloaded) as a result this will not render on customer instance. 

I would recommend that we change the current method of icons being rendered using fontset being changed to HTML entities instead.

There is also a security issue which have been reported by Microsoft recently the link can be found below :
https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/kb/3079904

You can see an example of a customer instance not rendering the fontset icons as per the screenshot attached below :
!fontset not rendering.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: change fontset 'icons' to html entities to improve security compliance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38978].
  {panel}

h1. Steps To Reproduce
# Create a new Confluence space (i.e. Example).
# Create a new page (i.e. Sample Page).
# Insert some contents, *highlight some texts* and *link* it to a Confluence page via '*+*' sign > *Link*.
# Export the Confluence space (i.e. Example) to *XML* format.
# Import the XML backup to a Confluence instance and check the _atlassian-confluence.log_ file.

(i) Please refer to [^StepsToReproduce.mp4] screen cast for visual information. You may use [^Example-Space.zip] to reproduce the problem.

h1. Expected Behaviour
Space import complete without errors.

h1. Actual Behaviour
Space import complete with the following warnings thrown in the _atlassian-confluence.log_ file.
{code}
2015-09-01 17:18:37,653 WARN [Long running task: Importing data] [importexport.xmlimport.persister.XHtmlBodyContentPropertyUserRewriter] translateBodyContentXhtmlProperty Unable to parse text of BodyContent 2359299 as XHTML storage format: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 475. Parser message: Unexpected EOF in CDATA section
 at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,475]
 -- referer: http://localhost:9581/confluence/admin/backup.action | url: /confluence/admin/restore.action | userName: admin | action: restore
2015-09-01 17:18:37,654 WARN [Long running task: Importing data] [importexport.xmlimport.persister.XHtmlBodyContentPropertyUserRewriter] translateBodyContentXhtmlProperty Unable to parse text of BodyContent 2359300 as XHTML storage format: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 497. Parser message: Unexpected EOF in CDATA section
 at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,497]
 -- referer: http://localhost:9581/confluence/admin/backup.action | url: /confluence/admin/restore.action | userName: admin | action: restore
{code}
(i) Note that the Confluence space import completes with the links working perfectly fine.
fields.summary: Unnecessary Warnings Thrown During Space Import that Contains Highlighted Linked Text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38977].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Attach a movie to a page.
# Insert a multimedia macro, showing your uploaded attachment. Ensure that autostart is unchecked.
# Save the page. The video will autoplay even though you left autostart unchecked.

Example page: https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2549712527

Workaround:

a) Insert the video using the new Files Previewer (just press Insert from the attachments page).

b) If that doesn't work (the Files Previewer notably doesn't support mp4s), you can use the following snippit in a HTML macro:

{code:html}
<video controls src="/download/attachments/pageId/attachmentName" width=1000 height=650>
{code}

* pageId can be found in the URL bar when you edit the page
* attachmentName is just the name of the file you uploaded
fields.summary: Multimedia macro always autoplays, regardless of the macro option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38976].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Anchors located in the automated numbering column in confluence tables are not preserved when additional rows are added.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table in Confluence Cloud
# Use the *Table Settings* to turn on 'Insert Numbering Column'
# Drag an Anchor into the Numbering Column
# Save the page and test you can link to the numbering column
# Edit the page and add a new row to the table

h3. Result
The Anchor in the Numbering Column disappears. 

h3. Suggested Solution
There are two options:
* Don't allow Anchors to be added to the automated numbering column; or
* Preserve the Anchor in the automated numbering column

h3. Workaround 
Place the Anchor in another column on the same row
fields.summary: Anchors and changes to automated numbering column in confluence tables are not preserved when additional rows are added

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38970].

h3. Problem Definition
When using the Linux installer to upgrade a non-default install directory in Confluence, the installer prints the default location of Confluence installations and then waits on input. This is confusing as there is no indication to enter the custom installation directory for the user.

h3. Suggested Solution
Print a quick line prompting the user to enter the full path to their custom installation directory so that the installer detects and upgrades that installation.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38967].
  {panel}

It seems that the login page URL have gotten slightly longer than before

As an example, in Confluence 5.4.1 the URL looks like this when you try to access the login screen of Confluence with the URL http://localhost:8092 it will change to :
http://localhost:8092/login.action?os_destination=%2Findex.action

In the latest Confluence release, we are seeing something like the following when we access the Base URL :
http://localhost:8102/login.action?os_destination=%2Findex.action&permissionViolation=true

You will notice that there is a extra parameter permissionViolation=true which seems to be hardcoded into our source code.

It will great if we could remove that parameter to make the URL shorter.
fields.summary: Shorten the base URL when accessing login page

fields.description:
We just migrated from Confluence 5.5.6 to Confluence 5.8.6. Unfortunately, our Microsoft LDAP (lazy loading) sync is not ending, after we defined the 'objectGUID' as Unique User Attribute on LDAP config. It is now migrating users for 5 days and 21 hours and does not seem to come to an end (current status 58% of 142,000 users). The amount of users migrated for an interval of one minute is shrinking from hundreds to only 5 per minute.

What we observed on system backend:
* Two CPU cores are used for 100%.
* According to an Oracle AWR report, most frequent statement (CPU times 74s) is 'select * from ( select journalent0_.entry_id as entry_id journalent0_.journal_name as journal_2_ journalent0_.creationdate as creation3_ journalent0_.type as type journalent0_.message as message from journalentry journalent0_ where (journalent0_.entry_id>:1 )and(journalent0_.journal_name=:2 )and(journalent0_.creationdate<=:3 ) order by journalent0_.entry_id asc ) where rownum <= :4*
* According to Performance Profiling, slowest / most time consuming method is '2015-08-26 09:11:19,765 DEBUG [scheduler_Worker-5] [atlassian.util.profiling.UtilTimerStack] log [1848ms] - PersonalInformationManager.getOrCreatePersonalInformation()'

Why is this method performing so slow?

Please find attached an excerpt of the page profiling.

For us this is a very serious issue since we really need a full working LDAP integration for user and group management!

The same issue is also valid for Confluence 5.8.9, which we also tested.
fields.summary: After Migration to Conf 5.8.6 LDAP Sync is not Ending due to Unique User Attribute

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38963].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When updating a Confluence space permissions In IE 11 the following error is raised:
{quote}
The following error(s) occurred:
•Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.
{quote}

h3. Environment
- Windows 8.1 pro
- IE 11
-- tested on multiple updates of IE 11 Most recent version tested: {{11.0.900617937}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Space permissions
# Edit permissions
# Attempt to add or remove any permissions
# Save

h3. Expected Results
- Permissions updated

h3. Actual Results
A User or group will be added with no permissions set if new user is being added but no permissions can be changed

The error pops up in UI:
{code}
The following error(s) occurred:
•Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.
{code}

Multiple errors in JS console error in IE developer tools relating to:
- {{File: doeditdefaultspacepermissions.action}}
- Noting IE Code has disabled caching linking to MS article on *Back navigation caching*
-- {{http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=291337}}
- See Attached Screenshot for full errors

h3.Workaround
Use Chrome or firefox latest stable version
fields.summary: Cannot Edit Space Permissions with IE 11

h3. Summary
Previous Confluence versions below 5.7 has a clear separate field of Page Title and Page Body.

In 5.7 and above, while using Internet Explorer 11, the top line of the body (Page title area) does not have indicative grey text.

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Confluence 5.8.x
# Create a new page using IE browser

h3. Expected Results
There is an indicative that the first line is page title area. See the screenshot below of correct behavior in Chrome and Firefox browsers:
!Chrome.jpg!

h3. Actual Results
There is no indicative grey text that the first line is a "Page Title" field:
!IE1.jpg!
 
h3. Notes
It appear only after you click down to a line below the Page Title field:
!IE2.jpg!
fields.summary: "Page Title" (field) prompt missing when creating a page in Internet Explorer

fields.description:
h2. Problem description
When installing Confluence using the binary installer, a dedicated "confluence" user should be created for the application service. This does not happen on SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11, and instead the resulting application instance is started by the root user. 

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Install SUSE Linux Enterprise Server and login to the operating system as root
# Download Confluence binary installer (version 5.8.9 was used for this test) and add the executable permission to the file
# Go through the install prompt, choosing Express Install and opting for the application to be installed as a service

h2. Expected result
* The Confluence process is running as a dedicated service user called "confluence"

h2. Observed/actual result
* The Confluence process is running as root (verified via {{ps aux | grep java}})
* The "confluence" user was never created (verified via {{grep 'confluence' /etc/pwd}}, which returns empty)

h2. Other notes
* This was tested on 5.8.9, but likely to affect earlier versions of the Installer as well.
* Likely related to same root cause as CONF-25346
fields.summary: Confluence installer does not create dedicated user when installing on SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11
Ability to configure which notification will be send to Watchers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38952].
  {panel}

This is a feature request to add the option to modify the content of the sidebar globally, as the user can do inside the space administration option for Confluence. 

When using the Default Global theme, in each space through *Space Tools > Configure Sidebar*, you have the option to change the navigation displayed for the users, by choosing the Navigation Display options, Shortcuts and content to be displayed. This could be applied globally, so all the spaces would be using the same configuration.

A situation to be used as example, would be that the user is doing a transition from the Documentation Theme to the new Default theme, but, the *Child Pages* option in the sidebar will still be needed. 

This request could be related to the current plans for new Confluence versions, as [this Task|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-38256] to remove the Documentation theme.
fields.summary: Option to Modify the Sidebar Globally in Default Theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38950].
  {panel}

If we try to go to our ['Troubleshooting Problems and Requesting Technical Support'|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Troubleshooting+Problems+and+Requesting+Technical+Support] page either directly or through our [new support documentation page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/getting-help-and-support-304578653.html] it looks ok.

Steps to reproduce:
# Log out of your account
# Try to access the page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Troubleshooting+Problems+and+Requesting+Technical+Support

This will then return a 404 error. Our documentation was previously available anonymously, and we link to this page fairly often so a lot of our users are seeing this issue.
fields.summary: 404 error when accessing support info page

fields.description:
In the users task list (/plugins/inlinetasks/mytasks.action) there appear tasks which actually do not exist any more as the according page has been deleted.

To replicate create a page with some tasks - assigned to yourself, to somone else and to noone -  and save it.
Delete the page.
Go to your task list and check for incomplete tasks - both assigned and created to yourself.
The tasks from the deleted page appear, the page itself isn't found anymore.
fields.summary: Tasks which were on a now deleted page show up in Task list
Confluence Linux installer does not create all directories with the right owner

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence that comes with Support Tools Plugin version 3.5.25 does not have an option to update the plugin from UI

h3. Environment
* Support Tools Plugin version 3.5.25 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Confluence 5.7.4
# Open Manage Add-Ons > All Add-Ons
# Search for Support Tools Plugin
# Expand the plugin

h3. Expected Results
As it is an outdated plugin, an option to "update plugin" to the latest version shoudl be available

h3. Actual Results
There is no option to update
!Capture.PNG|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
Other version of Confluence containing different version of outdated Support Tools Plugin *do* have the option to update. Below is the example of Confluence 5.8.4 with bundled Support Tools Plugin version 3.5.26
!Capture1.PNG|thumbnail!

Atlassian Marketplace does not list Support Tools Plugin version 3.5.25
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.support.stp/versions
fields.summary: No option to update Support Tools Plugin if the current installed version is 3.5.25

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

*Background of the request*
When user compare the changes made in page comparison they don't know who modified the words.

*Suggestion*
It will be easier if there is an option to see who change the words and etc in page comparison.
fields.summary: Option to see who modify the word in Page comparison

fields.description:
In Confluence when a member of "confluence-administrators" group can click "Edit" button and start editing the page. They receive a blank page when "cancel" button is clicked.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Make User B as the member of {{confluence-administrators}} group
# User A creates a page and applies a restriction to a specific group (Ensure that the User B is not part of this group)
# User B is Not a member of that group but Is a Space Administrator for the space
# User B goes to the page and the edit function is enabled
# User B Clicks Edit 
# User B Clicks Cancel

h3. Expected Results
Exit from the editor normally.

h3 Observed Result
Received a blank page
!sample.png|thumbnails!
fields.summary: Blank page when members of confluence-administrators exit from the editor in a  restricted pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38935].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The customer would like all the users with a particular start to the user names to be placed in a group based on the user name, for example c_ indicates a consultant. Currently the consultants have to be manually added to the consultants group.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add a feature to add to groups based on username as part of User Directory configuration.
fields.summary: Add users to group based on username

fields.description:
In the latest versions of Confluence, we have the bundled JIRA macro, which already is working on the compatible version with Confluence (5.6.12 in a 5.8.x Confluence). 

However, in [JIRA macro versions for Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence.extra.jira/versions], the latest available version is the 5.6.11, which is listing as incompatible with the 5.7.4 versions and above, for Confluence.
fields.summary: JIRA Macro Listing as Incompatible with Confluence 5.7.4 and Later Versions

fields.description:
Some gadgets retrieved form JIRA, in example, the Chart gadget and also the JIRA Road Map one are using the "Application URL" rather than the "Display URL" configured for the Application Links. 

In this example, the Application Links are configured as the following:

!applink.png!

Then, when you try to hover the cursor on one of the statistics from JIRA, in the Chart gadget, the application URL is used:

!gadgeturl1.png!

And the same goes for the Roadmap:

!gadgeturl2.png!
fields.summary: Some JIRA gadgets Do not Respect the Display URL

*Step to replicate*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38915].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When the service desk agents group is deleted from User Management in Cloud, it's not deleted in Confluence and no new Confluence users can login.

We are also noticing in some cases when group seems to have been deleted without service desk ever being enabled, users may not be aware that groups have been deleted but will see the symptom that newly created confluence users can't login. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Delete the service-desk-agents group in user management
# Create a new user in user management
# Give the new user Confluence Application Access
# Log into Confluence as new user

h3. Expected Results
User can login and use confluence

h3. Actual Results
User gets error
{noformat}
Not Permitted
You are not permitted to perform this operation.
{noformat}

The below exception is seen in the confluence log:
{noformat}
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: update or delete on table "cwd_group" violates foreign key constraint "fk_group_attr_id_group_id" on table "cwd_group_attribute"
Detail: Key (id)=( <some ID number> ) is still referenced from table "cwd_group_attribute".
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Log a support request with the Atlassian Cloud Support team, who will need to perform maintenance on Confluence.  This will involve around 20 minutes of down-time for Confluence so please advise when this can be performed when you log the ticket.
fields.summary: When the service desk agents group is deleted from User Management, it's not deleted in Confluence and new users can't access Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence pages show a stacktrace when a malformed labelManager.getContentInSpaceForLabel call is made

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence
# Create a user macro with the following:
{code}#set($labelmanager=$action.getLabelManager())
#set($label = new Label("test");)
$labelmanager.getContentInSpaceForLabel(0,10,"SDA",$label).getList()
$labelmanager.getContentForLabel(0, 10, $label).getList(){code}

h3. Expected Results
Even thought the request is not corect, it should show everything working except for the bugged user macro

h3. Actual Results
The page displays a stack trace
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
java.lang.RuntimeException: Error rendering template for decorator root
at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.velocity.ApplyDecoratorDirective.render(ApplyDecoratorDirective.java:191)
caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Error rendering template for decorator page
at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.velocity.ApplyDecoratorDirective.render(ApplyDecoratorDirective.java:191)
caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getWebInterfaceContext' in class com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.ViewPageAction threw exception net.sf.hibernate.LazyInitializationException: Failed to lazily initialize a collection at template/includes/menu-macros.vm[line 133, column 92]
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:223)
caused by: net.sf.hibernate.LazyInitializationException: Failed to lazily initialize a collection
at net.sf.hibernate.collection.PersistentCollection.initialize(PersistentCollection.java:201)
caused by: net.sf.hibernate.HibernateException: collection was evicted
at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.initializeCollection(SessionImpl.java:3332)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Confluence pages fail to render after making malformed API method call to labelManager.getContentInSpaceForLabel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When inserting an image inside a *{{Tip}}* / *{{Warning}}* macro, if the image use left of right alignment, macro rendering doesn't enlarge to include the image.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and insert *{{Tip}}* macro
 # Add some text to this macro and add an image after these text
 # Select the image and choose left alignment and save the page

h3. Expected Results

Macro rendering extends to cover the image:
 !expected.jpg|thumbnail! 


h3. Actual Results

Macro rendering finished at the end of the text and the image overflows the macro:
 !actual.jpg|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Please check the alignment for the image that is overflowing and remove it if there are any alignments.
fields.summary: Rendering image inside TIP macro overflows

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38904].
  {panel}

I know this has been [asked|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24088] [before|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-27030] and in both situations it was closed as "Won't Fix". But that was in 2011 and 2013.

We are in 2015, now. Markdown support is ubiquitous on the web. It's everywhere. It's even the default markup language used by Stash. 

I also know that there are Confluence plugins to add Markdown support, but currently in the market place, only one of those plugins is compatible with the Cloud hosted Confluence:

!MarketPlaceMarkdown.png|thumbnail!

And this plugin has a major drawback, it requires read access to the Confluence content as it sends it to their servers to be processed.

So, with all that said, can we please have an official markdown support on Confluence Cloud?

Thanks
fields.summary: Markdown support for Confluence

fields.description:
Say you have a non-standard colour scheme, and want to tweak the top bar colour:
# Go to Admin -> Colour Scheme
# Click 'Edit'
# Change the 'Top Bar' value
# Press enter

Boom! Your entire colour scheme has been reset to the blue defaults.
fields.summary: Colour Scheme resets to default when entering single field

fields.description:
We can not update the universal plugin manager (UPM) from version 2.19.3 to 2.19.4

When starting the update-process, we get the following Message:
"Problem accessing the file Atlassian Universal Plugin Manager Plugin."
